Theres nothing showing anywhere, 'MyPC' 'Device Manager' or even 'Disk Manager'.My keyboard and mouse can run from the USB 3 ports but not the drives? I've tried every tutorial i could find for 8 hours yesterday trying to rectify the situation. Last night i read that if the devices are plugged in during the upgrade then they wont be recognised. So i rolled back to Windows 7, where their still recognised, unplugged the usb external drives and upgraded again.Still the same problem. So whats going on?? The drives work in the USB 2 drives, and the keyboard and mouse work in the USB 2 and 3 drives? Anyone got any ideas on what to do, as the only option i see after today is a permanent rollback to win7 as i wouldn't want to risk a fresh clean install.My specs are:Asus P9X79 Pro motherboardIntel i7 3860 @ 3600ghz2047MB NVIDIA GeForce GTX 670 (EVGA)16gb DDR3 ram
solutions: Hi my name is Ross, I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.It sounds like it may be a driver issue, the USB controller is likely embedded onto your motherboard. I would suggest checking the Asus support site for update drivers for your motherboard model.Regards, Ross

windows.symptom: How To Remove Old Unwanted E-mail Contacts             .  I have a few old unwanted e-mail contacts in Windows 10 Peoples app. I also get the same Contacts addresses showing in the drop down menu in the Mail app when typing in a name.  I can find no way to delete the contact in either app.I get the following message when I click to edit.You can*t change recent contacts on your device.But you can add details on their contact card.I have never used this e-mail address in years.
solutions: Both Mail and People only read the data from the respective email accounts depending on which account is set in the app.Open People and select Settings (the gear at the top of the app window) under Accounts which account is shown. Is it the one you expect, is there more that one. Which ever account it is will be the account it reads from the contacts from. The same applies to the mail app.If you are using a Microsoft account in Mail then you should see the same info in a web browser as you see in the app.You can also go to Apps and Features and reset People. Right click Start and select Apps and Features scroll down to People and select Advanced. Scroll down again and select Reset, all the data will be removed from the People app and will be read in again from the account. Perhaps the database in the app has become corrupt and it need to fresh read what is on you account.

windows.symptom: Activation issue on Windows 10        My PC recently started asking me to activate windows, I have already had this computer for a few years and windows has always been activated. When I do end up clicking "go to settings" to activate windows the settings app opens then crashes.I have tried Win+pause-break to activate windows but it says that it is already activated.How do I fix this problem?***Original title:Windows activation error***
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand that you are facing issues with Activation issues on your PC. For further clarity on the issue, please respond to the questions below: Are you aware of any changes made to the PC prior to which you weren’t facing this issue?How did you obtain the License of Windows 10?When do you receive the popup to activate Windows?Do you see any error code/message related to activation? Concerning towards your query related to Settings app crashing, let’s try re-registering the Settings App using PowerShell command and see if that helps. Press Windows + X key together and selectWindows PowerShell (Admin).Accept the UAC prompts.Now type in the following command and hit Enter: Get-AppXPackage -AllUsers -Name windows.immersivecontrolpanel | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register “$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml” -Verbose}Restart the PC. Once you re-register Settings app, you should be able to access it. In case, it is still crashing try creating a new user account and see if you are able to access Settings. Refer the articleCreate a local user or administrator account in Windows 10 In addition, you may want to refer the article Get help with Windows activation errors Regards,Prakhar KhareMicrosoft Community – Moderator

Yes about that, I'm going for my dinner so BRB 😅
Sorry for late reply

Here is what I would do in order to explore the cause of this problem:Open the Device Manager via the Control Panel, then open Disk Drives. You should see all disk drives that are currently connected.Use a Windows USB Repair Disk to boot the machine into Repair Mode. Open a Command Prompt, then run diskpart.exe as before. The command List Disk should list all disk drives.Use the command RecoveryDrive.exe to create a Repair Disk. Do not copy the system files.

windows.symptom: Windows 10 Update 1909 - after update shutdown extremly slow down        Hi,after the windows 10 update 1909 the shutdown is extremly slow./dehade
solutions: Hi, dehade My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Follow these steps: Press the Start key and type the word CMD or Powershell, right click on the command prompt and select Run as administrator, enter the following commands one by one followed by the Enter key:•- DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Scanhealth •- DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth •- DISM.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup •- sfc /scannow https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/947821...
Hi Jeffrey,i executed the statements. They did not solve the problem./Detlev
Check this link, I hope it helps. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/929135...
With the clean boot option the shutdown is fast again.Is there an option to find out which application/ service is causing the issue ?/Detlev

I recommend you log in to Windows 10 again with a user who has administrator permissions and go back to System Settings. Within the Services tab, select the Hide all Microsoft services check box and continue to select the first half of services from the list, click Accept and continue Restart. If after the restart the problem persists, we must repeat the steps with the second half of the services listed. If the problem does not reproduce again, then we must limit the services and repeat these steps until we find the service that generates the conflict.Once detected, we will deactivate the checkbox for the element that causes us the problem so that it is deactivated and does not start automatically with the start of the system and then we can contact the manufacturer of the program to determine if it can solve the problem In this way, once we restart the computer in normal mode, we will be able to detect the original problem, it will no longer reproduce and we can install, uninstall, update or run the program with the service or program deactivated, it would conflict.

I have the same problem, intrduced with 1909.However I have noticed that the problem seems to happen when the computer is shutdown a short time after startup. If it has been allowed to run for some time, shutdown is normal.It is as if there is some Windows process which runs at startup and takes several minutes, and which has to be allowed to finish before Windows will shut down.
I have the exact same problem, a lot of users have the same problem, fortunately i thought i was the only one.
Hi,the shutdown was for me always slow, even after running 30 minutes or an hour.I did a clean install with windows 1909. With this the shutdown is fast again./Detlev

I never understood why "independent advisor" or "trusted consultants" always revert to L1 answers, especially this one.  It is unhelpful and waste of our time.  Clearly, you do not know what you are doing if this is your immediate response to the OP question.

I fixed the problem on my laptop(Asus K501UX).What happened:After updating to 1909, everything began to slow down. Installing the old version of windows, on which everything worked fine before, did not help.Solution:In BIOS reset to default settings.

windows.symptom: No "Reset This PC" option        Reset this PC option missing after replacing hard disk with a Samsung SSD and using Samsung Data Migration software to clone the existing drive.Analysis: using Control Panel -> Computer Management -> Disk ManagementOn original hard disk the WinRE recovery partition was last partition. On new hard disk that partition had moved to first position.Solution:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/127060-enable-disable-windows-recovery-environment-windows-10-a.htmlDisplay windows recovery environment information:reagentc /infoI had to set path to WinRE partition using the command (change harddisk# and partition# to suit your situation):reagentc /setreimage \\?\GLOBALROOT\device\harddisk0\partition1\Recovery\WindowsREThen enable (this automatically sets the identifier):reagentc /enable
solutions: Did you go Settings, U[dates, Recovery?  There you should find Reset this PC.

Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. For better clarity, it would be great if you can help us with the details requested below: Where exactly are you looking for the Reset this PC option?Were you able to successfully clone the drive?Could you please provide more clarity on, “On original hard disk the WinRE recovery partition was last partition. On new hard disk that partition had moved to first position”?Were you able to get the Reset this PC option by following the steps mentioned in the article provided by you? If you wish to reset the PC, there are multiple ways to do it. You may want to refer the steps mentioned in the articleReset or reinstall Windows 10. However, please reply with the details requested above to help you with the appropriate details. Regards,Nikhar KhareMicrosoft Community - Moderator

windows.symptom: How Robocopy copy the folder start with A?        Hi Recently i want to migrate my laptop to my desktop data, and i want to do it batch by batch So it is the below command is the correct command to copy the folder name start with Arobocopy C:\Users\xxx\ a*.* /S ?MIR Z:\Users\xxx\ /COPY:DT /DCOPY:TThank You
solutions: Hi there! I'm Steve, an Independent Advisor and a Windows user like you. I'm happy to help with your query.Based on the options you've defined the command you'll need will be: robocopy C:\Users\xxx\ Z:\Users\xxx\ a* /s /mir /copy:DT /dcopy:T Before starting the robocopy I would recommend to take a look at the following support article to confirm the options you want to use are correct:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server... Please let me know if I can be of any further assistance!

windows.symptom: Upgrade from Windows 7 to 10        Need a procedure for updating my home PC from Windows 7 to Windows 10. E-mail app to use? Using Windows Live Mail. How to migrate and not lose retained E-mails. Browser bookmarks migration? Should I migrate E-mail to Outlook before I upgrade Windows?***Modified title from: Windows 10 upgrade***
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I appreciate your interest in Windows 10. I understand that you want to upgrade your computer from Windows 7 to 10 and want to keep all your data. I’ll help you with all the details. Before upgrading the computer to Windows 10, we need a valid license and computer running with Windows 7 Service Pack 1. For more information, seeWindows 10 system requirements. We would also like to know the make and model of the computer.  To upgrade to Windows 10 you can use the Media Creation tool. Visit the websitehttps://www.microsoft.com/en-in/software-download/windows10 and click on Download tool now. Once the tool is downloaded, refer the steps mentioned in the articleHow to perform an In-place Upgrade with Windows 10 Step-by-Step Guide byPaulSey… Doing an in place upgrade with Keep files and apps option will not remove any data or applications from the computer. However, you can still take a backup of your favorites/bookmarks. Refer the steps mentioned in the articleMove Internet Explorer favorites to a new PC. Ideally, the email account syncs all the emails to the server and you can access them from anywhere. Windows 10 comes with an inbuilt email client named Windows Mail app. To setup email in Windows Mail app, refer the article onSet up email in the Mail app for Windows 10. For additional information, see Upgrade to Windows 10: FAQ. Let us know if you need any further assistance, we will be glad to help you further. Regards,Nikhar KhareMicrosoft Community - Moderator

You may find Windows Live Mail doesn't work in Windows 10, it is not supported.When the upgrade has completed if WLM is still working all your emails will be in place as they were in Windows 7. Windows 10 Mail app is the default for reading mail in Windows 10.As with any upgrade you need a backup of your personal files, this includes all Documents, Pictures etc. to be sure you can recover if something goes wrong. As far as WLM is concerned there should be and option to export all mail and contacts in the File menu. Be aware these cannot be imported into the Mail app, that function does not exist, however your mail should still be available from your mail provider via their website. Are you using a Microsoft account for mail or another.You might want to consider Thunderbird Mail which can import files from the WLM backup file.Also be aware you officially need a new licence for Windows 10 as the free upgrade period was only 2015 to 2016, but other users have found Windows 10 will activate automatically after the upgrade. If this is the case you need to keep your Windows 7 licence key for the future.

Hi,Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums.I appreciate your interest in Windows 10. I understand that you want to upgrade your computer from Windows 7 to 10 and want to keep all your data. I’ll help you with all the details.Before upgrading the computer to Windows 10, we need a valid license and computer running with Windows 7 Service Pack 1. For more information, seeWindows 10 system requirements. We would also like to know the make and model of the computer. To upgrade to Windows 10 you can use the Media Creation tool. However, you can still take a backup of your favorites/bookmarks. Refer the steps mentioned in the articleMove Internet Explorer favorites to a new PC.Ideally, the email account syncs all the emails to the server and you can access them from anywhere. Windows 10 comes with an inbuilt email client named Windows Mail app. To setup email in Windows Mail app, refer the article onSet up email in the Mail app for Windows 10.For additional information, see Upgrade to Windows 10: FAQ.Let us know if you need any further assistance, we will be glad to help you further.Regards,Nikhar KhareMicrosoft Community - Moderator I've done exactly this and my USB 3 ports no longer support USB 3 external hard drives, but still support USB 2 kindle, keyboard and mouse. windows.symptom: Windows 10 BSOD "ntoskrnl.wrong.symbols.exe"        Hello there,I am getting this failure partially 3 times a day. I don't know how to fix this issue.https://1drv.ms/u/s!AptZ5XGyMi5NatRicpGcxDkd61I?e=8MHFaK
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. I understand that you are facing Blue Screen of Death on your PC. For further clarity on the issue, please respond to the questions below: Which build version of Windows 10 are you using currently?Are you aware of any changes made to the PC prior to which you weren’t facing this issue?What is the make and model of the PC? Refer the article Which version of Windows operating system am I running? Based on the dump files that you have shared the issue seems to be with RAM. However, I would suggest you to follow the suggestions mentioned below and see if that helps. Method 1: Try booting the PC in Safe Mode and see if the PC crashes. Refer the articleStart your PC in safe mode in Windows 10 In case the PC is not crashing in Safe Mode then try booting the PC in Clean Boot and see if everything works fine. Refer the articleHow to perform a clean boot in Windows Performing a clean boot will start the computer with minimal set of drivers and programs, to determine whether a background program is causing the issue. Some of the Startup programs will not load after performing a clean boot on the computer. However, that functionality will return when you reset the computer to start normally after finishing the troubleshooting. If the PC doesn’t crash after performing Clean Boot, then please refer the sectionHow to determine what is causing the problem after you do a clean boot to identify the root cause of the issue. Note: Please refer the section Reset the computer to start normally after clean boot troubleshooting to boot the computer in to normal mode after troubleshooting Method 2: Run the Windows Memory Diagnostic tool to check for RAM issues.  Press Windows + S keys together to openSearch.Now type Memory and click on Windows Memory Diagnostic.Click on Restart now and check for problems.Follow the on screen instructions Let us know how it goes. Regards,Prakhar KhareMicrosoft Community – Moderator

windows.symptom: Upgraded to Windows 10 from 8.1 & can't login        I just finished installing Windows 10 from 8.1. The install was successful with no errors.I am on the login screen, I input the correct password, it says Welcome like it is starting to open, then goes back to the login screen. This loop repeats itself indefinitely.I tried the troubleshoot, advanced options, startup repair, and it did it's thing and went right back to the login loop.What can i do? Please help!Update:  I rebooted in safe mode and it did some updates for 15 minutes or so, then safe mode booted up.  I backed up a few important files, then restarted in normal mode and everything went fine.  Weird.  Guess those were some important updates.  Just thought I'd update in case anyone else ever has this problem.
solutions: Are you using a MS account or a local user account. It does sound like the upgrade didn't quite go right.At the sign-in screen in the bottom right hand corner you should see a power icon. Select that and hold down Shift and select Restart. You should go to a Diagnostic mode that shows the Troubleshoot menu.At the Troubleshoot menu select Advanced options and then see if you can enter Safe Mode via the Start-up Settings item.
That's exactly what I ended up doing.
Does your normal account sign-in okay now, do you still have problems.?

windows.symptom: Windows 10 CAPS lock function only changes if changing application focus        We have a new Dell Laptop; Windows 10. I am not sure when this issue started (out of the box or after 3rd party apps installed).There is an issue with changing between upper and lower case using the CAPS lock key. The key works, in that the light comes on, but in whatever application is focused at the time, the text does not change to upper case. If you click focus away and then back to the application, the text is now uppercase. This is the same if typing in uppercase and then changing to lower case.Some testing done;Bought up on-screen keyboard. Pressing the physical CAPS lock key (cycling) has the on screen keyboard correctly toggle the caps lock state.If you were in lower case and changed to upper case, typing on the hardware keyboard remains in lower case, however type by using the on screen keyboard has text in uppercase.The shift button has text displayed correctly as upper case.Plugging in an external USB keyboard results in the same, incorrect behavior.It clearly appears to not be a hardware issue, but something software related. Has anyone any idea why the change in CAPS lock state only registers if you focus away from and then back to the application being used? This is the same for Windows search box, notepad, and command line.
solutions: Unable to find a reason for the issue we reset the laptop back to factory which resolved the issue. As we now set about re-installing the apps, we continually check to see if the issue occurs again. We will post further if it happens again and thus can isolate the reason

windows.symptom: Windows 10 repair mode password reset        I turned on my computer and it got stuck on windows loading so I went to the windows repair mode and entered my password (Microsoft linked account), it said it is incorrect. I went to my account and changed it from my phone (since my computer is not loading) and tried again and it's still not working. I am assuming my computer doest update the password changes if it is not fully "up"? I can't load my computer or reset my windows now since I can't change my password. Is there anything I can do now?
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. In order to get clarity and to assist you accordingly, please reply with the answers to the questions below. What is the Windows 10 version and Build installed? (Type winver in Windows search/Run command)How did you go to windows repair mode?Are you able to go to the Windows login screen? Create a bootable USB using another PC and perform a startup repair on the computer. Refer the articleCreate a bootable media to create a bootable USB. You need to change the first boot device in the BIOS. Boot the computer using bootable USB.On the Install Windows screen, select Next >Repair your computer. On the System Recovery Options screen, select Troubleshoot> Advanced options > Startup Repair.Restart the PC. Note:Modifying BIOS/ complementary metal oxide semiconductor (CMOS) settings incorrectly can cause serious problems that may prevent your computer from booting properly. Microsoft cannot guarantee that any problems resulting from the configuring of BIOS/CMOS settings can be solved. Modifications of the settings are at your own risk.   To address your query, yes you need to load the PC to the Windows login screen and need to be connected to internet. Then the password will update on the PC. Regards, Aditya RoyMicrosoft Community – Moderator
